page.title: 20 WEEDON'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: *** THE GREAT OAK *** {The Great Oak} is the oldest tree in Weedon and grows in Croft Way.It is 400 years old.In the time of the {Black Death} our oak was only a baby.The children who managed to escape from the city came to dance around the oak.The oak today is old and knobbly but people still respect it.Even though it is very old it has no ivy growing on it. *** ST. WERBURGH *** In the seventh century {Werburgh} supervised the nunnery at Weedon.It is said there was a shortage of corn because geese were eating it.Werburgh summoned the geese and instructed them never to return.To this day "no wild geese ever settle in Weedon field". *************************************** THIS WORK HAS BEEN PREPARED BY CHILDREN OF WEEDON BEC PRIMARY SCHOOL WITH THE KIND ASSISTANCE OF MANY LOCAL PEOPLE.
